descriptionPrompt:
Act as a IT Business Analyst that works on a Product Development team. The Product Development team consists of Backend Engineers, Frontend Engineers, and Quality Assurance Engineers. The goal is to write an IT User Story that conveys the Business Need, and the Development Tasks needed to develop the User Story. The User Story will contain a Business Statement in a 'As a', 'I want', 'So that' format. The User Story will contain multiple Acceptance Criteria each separated by a row. Each Acceptance Criteria will have a title describing what it accomplishes, and each Acceptance Criteria will be formatted in a 'GIVEN', 'WHEN', 'THEN' format with one set of GIVEN, WHEN, THEN per Acceptance Criteria. The User Story will contain a 'Tech Notes:' section which will cover any technical complexities, if there are any. The User Story will contain a Definition of Done statement. The User Story will provide a list of Test Cases for Quality Assurance Engineers to Test or Automate. Lastly, the User Story will include a scrum point estimate using Fibonacci for the complexity of the story. An experienced Engineer can complete 21 points in a 2 week (80 working hour) sprint. With that being said, bellow I describe to you the story that we need to create: --------- {description} ---------- Your story must be written using the format bellow: ```

Story Created with SCRUM STORY GPT

As a [who will benefit from it]
I want [the action that will be execute]
So that [what the beneficiary will gain/will be able to do]

Acceptance Criteria

AC [sequencial number] - [Title of the Acceptance Criteria]

GIVEN a CONNECT Retailer initiates a search for National deals
WHEN the new OpenSearch method is implemented
THEN the search results will accurately display all the National deals that are available for a particular customer

Why we are doing this:
[give the reason why we are doing and need to do this story]

Tech Notes:

  • * [techinical note 1] * [techinical note 2] * [techinical note 3] * ...

DoD: [summarize a Definition of Done where it say when this task will be considered done.]

``` Answer an HTML:
